title: Lag
body: I've seriously lost it now Riot. Here i was looking forward to playing all double IP weekend, but alas due to 200-5000 ping spikes every 30 seconds I've only been able to play 6 games. I just left a game where exactly this happened and i'm not going to be surprised if i get banned for 3 days again. Yes i'm not the best at staying in losing games, i often leave them when there is no hope and i except when i get banned because it was my fault. But when i lose to lag, i can't play at all and often feed because i'm 'frozen' in these moments of pure lag. If these don't get fixed i'm afraid Riot, you've lost a player.

replies.body: I tend to agree, and people having lag spike issues on Oceania are NOT rare... I would be happy if Riot said it was on my end but it doesn't even seem like they know...

Have no problems with other games, but only league and especially aram games from 6pm to 10pm roughly. Sometimes I get into good games of 60 ping, but most of the time within that time scale i get average of 150 throughout the whole game, making most skillshot and kiting champs unplayable. And it's horrible playing with more than 70 ping.

Its easy to blame Riot and all, but if the other 9 players in the game have no problem then that means the server is likely working with stability. I too get ping troubles... using my pocket wifi but not my main connection which is also pretty bad to be honest. Considering I have no major troubles with ping on my connection at home when I do with Garry's Mod, Nosgoth, Neverwinter, Bloody Good Time, Sanctum.......
Basically, my point is that I have a lot of games where I do have ping issues yet LoL isn't one of them.
